alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 4:39PM EDT until September 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY... At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated initial thunderstorms producing heavy rain had moved out of the area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. However, additional thunderstorms are approaching from the south, and additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Forestville... Coral Hills... Bladensburg... Andrews Air Force Base... Landover... Camp Springs... Walker Mill... Temple Hills... Cheverly... Marlow Heights... Seat Pleasant... Kenilworth... Carmody Hills-Pepper Mill Village...Greater Landover... District Heights... Capitol Heights... Morningside... Fairmount Heights... Colmar Manor... Cottage City... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
